ai.grakn

Interface GraknGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractGraknGraph, GraknOrientDBGraph, GraknTinkerGraph, GraknTitanGraph

    public interface GraknGraph
extends AutoCloseable

    A Grakn Graph

    This is produced by Grakn.session(String, String) and allows the user to construct and perform basic look ups to a Grakn Graph. This also allows the execution of Graql queries.

    Author:
    fppt

    • Method Summary

      Reverts any changes done to the graph and closes the transaction.

    • Method Detail

      • putEntityType

        EntityType putEntityType(String label)
        Create a new EntityType with super-type entity, or return a pre-existing EntityType, with the specified label.
        Parameters:
        label - A unique label for the EntityType
        Returns:
        A new or existing EntityType with the provided label
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed
        ConceptNotUniqueException - if the is already in use by an existing non-EntityType.

      • putResourceType

        <V> ResourceType<V> putResourceType(String label,
                                    ResourceType.DataType<V> dataType)
        Create a new non-unique ResourceType with super-type resource, or return a pre-existing non-unique ResourceType, with the specified label and data type.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The data type of the resource type. Supported types include: String, Long, Double, Boolean. This should match the parameter type
        Parameters:
        label - A unique label for the ResourceType
        dataType - The data type of the ResourceType. Supported types include: DataType.STRING, DataType.LONG, DataType.DOUBLE, and DataType.BOOLEAN
        Returns:
        A new or existing ResourceType with the provided label and data type.
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed
        ConceptNotUniqueException - if the is already in use by an existing non-ResourceType.
        ConceptException - if the is already in use by an existing ResourceType which is unique or has a different datatype.

      • putResourceType

        <V> ResourceType<V> putResourceType(TypeLabel label,
                                    ResourceType.DataType<V> dataType)
        Create a new non-unique ResourceType with super-type resource, or return a pre-existing non-unique ResourceType, with the specified label and data type.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The data type of the resource type. Supported types include: String, Long, Double, Boolean. This should match the parameter type
        Parameters:
        label - A unique label for the ResourceType
        dataType - The data type of the ResourceType. Supported types include: DataType.STRING, DataType.LONG, DataType.DOUBLE, and DataType.BOOLEAN
        Returns:
        A new or existing ResourceType with the provided label and data type.
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed
        ConceptNotUniqueException - if the is already in use by an existing non-ResourceType.
        ConceptException - if the is already in use by an existing ResourceType which is unique or has a different datatype.

      • getConcept

        <T extends Concept> T getConcept(ConceptId id)
        Get the Concept with identifier provided, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        id - A unique identifier for the Concept in the graph.
        Returns:
        The Concept with the provided id or null if no such Concept exists.
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed
        ClassCastException - if the concept is not an instance of T

      • getType

        <T extends Type> T getType(TypeLabel label)
        Get the Type with the label provided, if it exists.
        Parameters:
        label - A unique label which identifies the Type in the graph.
        Returns:
        The Type with the provided label or null if no such Type exists.
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed
        ClassCastException - if the type is not an instance of T

      • getResourcesByValue

        <V> Collection<Resource<V>> getResourcesByValue(V value)
        Get all Resources holding the value provided, if they exist.
        Type Parameters:
        V - The data type of the value. Supported types include: String, Long, Double, and Boolean.
        Parameters:
        value - A value which a Resource in the graph may be holding.
        Returns:
        The Resources holding the provided value or an empty collection if no such Resource exists.
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed

        Throws:

      • admin

        GraknAdmin admin()
        Returns access to the low-level details of the graph via GraknAdmin
        Returns:
        The admin interface which allows you to access more low level details of the graph.
        See Also:
        GraknAdmin

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Utility function used to check if the current transaction on the graph is a read only transaction
        Returns:
        true if the current transaction is read only

      • showImplicitConcepts

        void showImplicitConcepts(boolean flag)
        Utility function to specify whether implicit and system-generated types should be returned.
        Parameters:
        flag - Specifies if implicit and system-generated types should be returned.

      • implicitConceptsVisible

        boolean implicitConceptsVisible()
        Utility function to specify whether implicit concepts should be exposed.
        Returns:
        true if implicit concepts are exposed.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Closes and clears the current graph.
        Throws:
        GraphRuntimeException - if the graph is closed

      • getKeyspace

        String getKeyspace()
        Utility function to get the name of the keyspace where the graph is persisted.
        Returns:
        The name of the keyspace where the graph is persisted

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Utility function to determine whether the graph has been closed.
        Returns:
        True if the graph has been closed

      • graql

        QueryBuilder graql()
        Returns a QueryBuilder
        Returns:
        returns a query builder to allow for the creation of graql queries
        See Also:
        QueryBuilder

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the current transaction. Rendering this graph unusable. You must use the GraknSession to get a new open transaction.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • abort

        void abort()
        Reverts any changes done to the graph and closes the transaction. You must use the GraknSession to get a new open transaction.

      • commit

        void commit()
     throws GraknValidationException
        Commits any changes to the graph and closes the transaction. You must use the GraknSession to get a new open transaction.
        Throws:
        GraknValidationException - when the transaction contains graph mutations which does not conform to the Grakn knowledge model.
